Natalia Szczepanik

Software Engineer (GenAI, Automation, Backend)
Remote · Building AI-powered products, automations and web apps that solve real user problems.
hello@naithai.dev · linkedin.com/in/naithai · github.com/natiixnt

I build backend systems, AI-powered features and automations that make teams faster. I like owning things end to end: from problem and data model, through API design and implementation, to deployment, monitoring and iterations with users.

Currently open for remote roles and freelance work in Poland and across the EU.

About

I am a software engineer focused on GenAI, automation and backend development. I like building things that solve real problems for developers and business teams: RAG systems, internal tools, workflow automations and AI assistants that live inside the tools people already use.

I started running my own projects and working with clients while still in school, which forced me to learn fast and take responsibility for real systems early. Since then I have founded an AI based edtech product, built automations for service and real estate businesses, and delivered internal tools for NGOs and small teams.

On the technical side I work mainly with Python and Node.js on the backend, React and TypeScript on the frontend and cloud services like AWS and GCP. I integrate LLMs, vector databases and external APIs, but I also care a lot about data models, validation, error handling and observability. My favourite projects are the ones where I can own a piece of the platform end to end and iterate directly with users.

Right now I am looking for roles where I can combine software engineering, GenAI and automation, preferably in product teams that care about quality, data and long term impact.

Experience

Founder and AI Product Engineer – SchoolMaster

2025 – now
  • Co creating an AI driven education platform helping teachers plan learning, generate materials and support students.
  • Owning large parts of the architecture and implementation: backend services, AI logic and integrations.
  • Designing prompts, flows and data models so that AI features are reliable and useful in real school workflows.
  • Working directly with early adopters, gathering feedback and turning it into roadmap iterations.

Freelance Software and Automation Engineer

2023 – now
  • Designing and implementing backend services and internal tools in Python and Node.js.
  • Building workflow automations and integrations using n8n, Make and Zapier that connect CRMs, forms, email, calendars and content platforms.
  • Integrating OpenAI and other LLMs into business processes for document generation, smart replies and decision support.
  • Focusing on clear architecture, data quality and logging so that systems are easy to maintain and extend.

Fullstack and Automation Developer – NGOs and Foundations

2022 – 2024
  • Built small web apps and admin panels integrated with Google Workspace and other SaaS tools.
  • Automated repetitive tasks like mailings, reporting and volunteer communication.
  • Introduced AI based tools for text generation, summarisation and content preparation.
  • Worked closely with non technical teams, translating their needs into working tools.

  • Generated property descriptions and social posts with AI based on key parameters.
  • Published listings to website and social channels, reducing time per listing from over an hour to a few minutes.
Highlights

Highlights

Tech: n8n, Python, webhooks, REST APIs, CRM, logging and alerting

Ongoing

Interests

I like working at the intersection of AI, automation and developer experience. I enjoy turning messy processes and data into clear systems, tools and workflows that save people time and mental energy.

Outside of work I train at the gym and play sports, follow what is happening in AI and software, and work on side projects that mix code, learning and social impact. I like environments where I can grow fast, share what I learn and ship things that are actually used.
